text: Wallace Druce Elmer (January 1, 1898 – August 28, 1978) was a professional ice hockey player who played in the Western Canada Hockey League. He played with the Saskatoon Crescents/Sheiks and Victoria Cougars. He would win a Stanley Cup with the Cougars in 1925. He was the last surviving former player of the Victoria Cougars. ==External Links== * *Wallace Elmer - Kingston & District Sports Hall of Fame Category:1898 births Category:1978 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey forwards Category:Place of death missing Category:Saskatoon Sheiks players Category:Stanley Cup champions Category:Victoria Cougars (1911–1926) players
title: Wally Elmer
